segments.text: I just absolutely got hammered in that role and probably luckily so because I wasn't the right fit for it but I couldn't find a way out I was missing out on support roles because I was attracted to the news department and therefore I felt like my credibility and something that I loved and I knew it was slipping away and instead it was the first time that I had been really heavily almost bullied I would say almost bullied from that side of people saying that I was terrible they didn't want me there so it was a really hard time and I have never been more I think gutted and down the dumps about something I couldn't change the narrative I couldn't fix it and that was incredibly difficult

segments.speaker: A
segments.text: So these are something quite radical though. I mean, you went into macadamia nut farming.

segments.speaker: A
segments.text: Sam, my husband has always been huge support for me and we had had out the child by the time, you know, I feel pretty was doing the weather and through that time I came back from maternity leave, back into the weather and wasn't enjoying it still, felt like I was a little bit lost, wasn't sure if I was, my future was still in TV,

segments.speaker: A
segments.text: but ultimately we took a huge leap of faith where I left a network contract because I felt like I was losing control of my own narrative and I wanted to be able to say yes to projects that I wanted to do and I wanted to be able to explore.

text:
I just absolutely got hammered in that role and probably luckily so because I wasn't the right fit for it but I couldn't find a way out I was missing out on support roles because I was attracted to the news department and therefore I felt like my credibility and something that I loved and I knew it was slipping away and instead it was the first time that I had been really heavily almost bullied I would say almost bullied from that side of people saying that I was terrible they didn't want me there so it was a really hard time and I have never been more I think gutted and down the dumps about something I couldn't change the narrative I couldn't fix it and that was incredibly difficult
So these are something quite radical though. I mean, you went into macadamia nut farming. That wouldn't have been the next stop on my chart if I was charting your career. I mean, how did you end up there, John? I was lucky again, Sam, my husband has always been huge support for me and we had had out the child by the time, you know, I feel pretty was doing the weather and through that time I came back from maternity leave, back into the weather and wasn't enjoying it still, felt like I was a little bit lost, wasn't sure if I was, my future was still in TV, but ultimately we took a huge leap of faith where I left a network contract because I felt like I was losing control of my own narrative and I wanted to be able to say yes to projects that I wanted to do and I wanted to be able to explore.
